Class Util

java.lang.Object
no.geosoft.timeseries.util.Util
public final class Util extends Object
A collection of useful utilities for time series.

  • Method Details

    • getSpaces

      public static String getSpaces(int n)
      Return a string containing the specified number of space characters.
      Parameters:
      n - Length of string to create.
      Returns:
      Requested string. If n is less than or equal to 0 an empty string is returned. Never null.

    • toUtf8

      public static byte[] toUtf8(Object object, int nBytes)
      Return the UTF-8 string representation of the specified object as a specific length byte array.
      Parameters:
      object - Object to get string representation of. May be null.
      nBytes - Number of bytes in returned value. [0,>.
      Returns:
      The requested string representation. Never null.

    • getAsDouble

      public static double getAsDouble(Object value)
      Convenience method to return the specified value as a double.
      Parameters:
      value - Value to represent as a double value. May be null if this is a no-value.
      Returns:
      The requested double value.

    • getAsType

      public static Object getAsType(double value, Class<?> valueType)
      Return the specified double value as an equivalent object of the specified type.
      Parameters:
      value - Value to convert. May be null.
      valueType - Value type to convert to. Non-null.
      Returns:
      Object of type dataType. May be null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If valueType is null.

    • getAsType

      public static Object getAsType(Object value, Class<?> valueType)
      Return the specified value as an object of the given type.
      Parameters:
      value - Value to consider. Null if no-value.
      valueType - Type to convert to. Non-null.
      Returns:
      The requested object. Null if no-value.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If valueType is null.

    • getNSignificantDigits

      public static int getNSignificantDigits(double magnitude, double step)
      Return the number of significant digits needed to properly represent values of regular data of the specified step and (maximum) magnitude.

      The intent is to find the correct number of significant digits in order to properly preserve the regularity of such numbers.

      Parameters:
      magnitude - Magnitude of the numbers in question. Typically the max value of the range.
      step - The regular step value.
      Returns:
      The requested number of significant digits. [0,>.

    • toString

      public static String toString(double d)
      Format the specified floating point number to a string with the most sensible number of decimals.
      Parameters:
      d - Double number to format.
      Returns:
      Associated string representation.

    • toString

      public static String toString(String text, int length)
      Return a fixed length string version of the specified text, either right clipped or right padded with spaces.
      Parameters:
      text - Text to return. May be null.
      length - Length of returned text. [0,>.
      Returns:
      Requested sring. Never null.
